revised_title: On the Communication of Double Refraction to Glass and Other Substances by Mechanical Compression and Dilatation
tldr: The author investigates the effects of mechanical compression and dilatation on glass and other substances, discovering that they can exhibit double refraction and polarize light similar to certain crystalline materials. The study provides a method for measuring mechanical changes in transparent bodies and has implications for understanding the strength of materials and cohesion of solids.
